text: Aroma of vinegar and spice, tastes a little spicy with a sweetish start and a bitter finish
Small sake glass full. Pours a clear yellow colour. Aroma of rice, apple, vinegar, alcohol. Taste has notes of rice, fruit, alcohol. Texture is thick, full bodied

750ml bottle (Stockmann, Tallinn)
Bland aroma, rice, vague fruitiness, maybe apple. Looks like slightly impure tapwater. Taste is super-crazy bland. This is like kossu-vissu, maybe a bit sweeter. Erm?
From bottle, warm at GKI. Clear. Lots of acetone, almonds and red apple in the nose, alcohol, a little plm and red fruit in the mouth. Full body, a little sticky texture.
Bottle.Taste sample 0.03l at Marukoshi restaurant Belgrade Serbia.Pour it clear white color.Aroma miso paste.Taste of fermented rice, harsh.First time I try Sake in my life.Ok
UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016 My first sake.... rated. Very pale pinky color. Aroma is slightly rice with alcohol and vinegar. Flavor is slightly sweet, flowery and a light presence of alcohol.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Max. Pours clear yellow, aroma of alcohol, plum, apples, watery, alcohol, light bodied.

72cl bottle. Pours clear with a slight yellowish tinge, no head and aroma of rice, melon. Taste is similar, rice, melon with woody, earthy, grassy notes and boozy alcohol. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, dry finish. Quite OK.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Max. Clear water-like appearance. Aroma of rice, mild fruitiness and alcohol. Sweet flavor with rice, light fruitiness, a bit of wood and lots of alcohol. I dont like this at all.

Bottled. Very pale pinky colour with no head. Aroma is mild tart wood, some alcohol, slick sweet rice notes as well as some mild minty notes. Flavour is fruity, floral, wooden and slightly alcoholic with some mild strange acidicness to it.

Bottle. Since this is my first sake rating I rate it as a strong alcohol. Slighlty pink color. Sour, medicine, spirit, woody aroma. Not too repulsive I have to admit. Citrus, woody, lemonade and alcohol im taste. Smooth, but at the same time you can feel the alcohol bite. Feels cheap, but since I got no experience on that field I might be wrong.

Bottle bought at an Asian supermarket for 2.49 Euro and shared with MichaelBruch. Soft taste of sparkling wine without the sparkle and mild roses. No carbonation, no bitterness or dryness. Delicate sake.
Bottle shared with McTapps. First sip was a bit tasteless and disappointing but after a few sips more a nice aroma of plum and maybe apple developed. Wouldve loved to have a second bottle. Great.
Cold.  Tastes like rice wine vinegar but nice and sweet.  This is my first sake so I dont know what to compare it to.  Drank at fin.

Pours completely clear. Nose of mild  black bean and generally sweet, dry and like an old cellar. Taste of more fermented bean curd, sweetness and some alcohol. Palate medium to full, long persistent finish. I think this is good but it is my first sake so difficult to judge.

Bottle 720ml.Cristal clear water colour with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, coconut, almond notes. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet with a long duration, alcohol, rice. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20111105]
Bottle @ Ulfborg Early Winter Tasting, 2011. Pours clear no color with no head. Rice and alcohol. A bit boozy.

Bottle, 72cl. Pours with a light yellowish color to an else clear body. Cellar, cooked rice and apples on the nose. Some boozy hints, even though its only 13,5% ABV. The flavor has a distinct fruityness to deal with the rice, and then the alcohol kicks in adding an extra dimension. Well, that might lead you to think this is a complex and superb sake, but I dont feel it that way. Slighlty warming on the palate. A drinkable one indeed, but not worth a detour. 111105

Clear as water. Aroma is quite sweet, fruity, rice and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish with lots og alcohol. 051111
Bottle @ FOneFan. Clear as water with no head. Aroma is rice and almond. Flaovur is rice, almond, little liquorice and medium sweet with notes of alcohol.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. No head. Color is like water. Aroma and taste are almonds, marzipan, rice malt and alcohol.

Alkohollastiger Geruch, welcher an Weizenkorn erinnert. Im Hintergrund nach Pflaume. Alkoholischer Start, leicht fruchtug. Mittig pflaumig, weich und liquide, säuerlich. Abgang getreidig, scharf.
Trinkbar - nicht unbedingt ein Renner.
Áramütésszerűen megcsíp, fejbevág. Mazsola. Tempera. Forralt bor. Semmivel se hasonlítható. Meg még valami felhő vagy zápor. Záporfelhő!
Has a foggy body and a sweet rice aroma. Drinkable but a little sweet, and no grassy notes.

First Sake Rate.  Clear and ple in the glass.  The nose has a port like boozy quality and a floral fruity character. It is watery in the mouth and quite bland. Sweet throughout with slightly off flavours of a peary nature.  Not hugely keen.

cold:
clear no head.
aroma faint alc, sweet and mild and soft aroma of rice.
flavor of herbs, alc, rice.
palata is a bit watery but it suits this sake well.
overall i liked especially the way it all is balanced.
720 ml. botella. Clear colour. Sweet mild bitter rice aroma. Good mouthfeel. The flavour is soft with a mild sweetness, rice and bitterness. Dry bitter rice finish. One of the more rough sakes.

Bottled. A light yellow sake - almost like water. The aroma is of alcohol and rice. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol and rice, the alcohol burns lightly in the mouth and carries all the way thru to the finish. Thanks Fiulijn for sharing.
Bottle thanks to Fiulijn. A water coloured sake with no head. Sweet herbal and alcoholic aroma and taste. Light body with a sweet dry alcoholic finish.
Smooth & Dry indeed with delicate floral hints on the nose. Well balanced and easy drinking.
(Bottle 25 cl) Courtesy of fiulijn. Clear as water with a slight hue. Intense, alcoholic aroma. The body is a little watery with an underlying sweetness. A warming alcohol in the finish. 171107
Slight yellow color. Rich, sweet, alcohol, fruit and herbal. Hmm, my first sake, my never come back for another try!! LOL
Off plum color with visible viscosity on pour. Smells of peapods and sugar.  Taste is same, but with plum and added sickly sweetness.

Bottle.  Clear, slightly yellow.  Aromas are alcohol and pepper with earthy mushroom and sweet white wine notes.  Flavours are lightly fruity with spices and alcohol.  Dry and clean on the finish with alcohol burn.  Not sure if this is a decent sake but it is a decent drink.

Bottle, pale lemon yellow, no head or condition. Sweet and spirity with hints of fruity melon and gentle mushroomy funkiness in the nose. Full bodied and sweet in the mouth with alcohol quite apparent. Lingering starchy finish with hints of mould and a slightt peppery spiciness at the end.

Totally clear color - with a light nice sour, fruity nose. Light sweetness but also some bitter hints as of an unripe plum. Medium dry finish.  Not bad - but what do I know - gotta try more Sakes to really know.
